author: Rick
content:
I bought a 'bridge' camera several years ago, and whilst it does 90% of what I wanted a camera to do, the inability to have the shallow DOF is, at times, creatively challenging. Or another way, a pain in the proverbial!

I wish I had saved my money and bought a DSLR. Trouble is, most of the time the bridge is fine for my needs and there's no real justification to get rid of it and upgrade. Now if I had the money...
